Or you might call on numerous such beings as you pursue goals aligned with theirs. Your pact allows you to experience the barest touch of the holy light that illuminates the multiverse.

subclassFeature.name: Extended Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Extended Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Celestial Extended Spells
rows: {@spell sacred flame}, {@spell light}, {@spell cure wounds}, {@spell guiding bolt}
{@spell guardian of faith}, {@spell wall of fire}

subclassFeature.name: The Archfey
entries: Your pact draws on the power of the Feywild, the mysterious realm of the Fey. When you choose this subclass, you might make a deal with a single mighty archfey, such as the Prince of Frost; the Queen of Air and Darkness, ruler of the Gloaming Court; Titania of the Summer Court; Oberon, the Green Lord; Hyrsam, the Prince of Fools; or an ancient hag. Or you might call on a wide spectrum of Fey, forging a complex web of favors and debts. Your patron’s motivations are often inscrutable, and sometimes whimsical, and might involve a striving for greater magical power or the settling of age-old grudges.

subclassFeature.name: Extended Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Extended Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Archfey Extended Spells
rows: {@spell calm emotions}, {@spell phantasmal force}, {@spell misty step}

subclassFeature.name: Steps of the Fey
entries: {@i 1st-level Archfey feature}

Your patron bestows on you the ability to move between the boundaries of the planes. You can cast {@spell misty step} without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
In addition, whenever you cast that spell, you can choose one of the following additional effects.

items: {@i {@b Refreshing Step.}} Immediately after you teleport, one creature you can see within 10 feet of you gains {@dice 1d10} Temporary Hit Points.

{@i {@b Taunting Step.}} Creatures within 5 feet of the space you left must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have Disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Misty Escape
entries: {@i 6th-level Archfey feature}
You can vanish in a puff of mist in response to harm. You can cast {@spell misty step} as a Reaction in response to taking damage.
In addition, the following effects are now among your Steps of the Fey options.

items: {@i {@b Disappearing Step.}} You have the {@condition invisible} condition until the start of your next turn or until immediately after you make an attack roll or cast a spell.

{@i {@b Dreadful Step.}} Creatures within 5 feet of the space you left or the space you appear in (your choice) must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Beguiling Defenses
entries: {@i 10th-level Archfey feature}
Your patron teaches you how to guard your mind and body. You are immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.

In addition, immediately after a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can use your Reaction to reduce the damage you take by half (round down), and you can force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC.

On a failed save, the attacker takes Psychic damage equal to the damage you take. Once you use this Reaction, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest unless you expend a spell slot when you use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Bewitching Magic
entries: {@i 14th-level Archfey feature}

Your patron bestows on you the ability to weave your magic with teleportation. Immediately after you cast an Enchantment or Illusion spell using an action and a spell slot, you can cast {@spell misty step} as part of the same action and without expending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: The Legendary Hero
entries: Each age has its heroes that stave off the darkness, and after their time has come, these heroes fade into legend and myth. Some especially powerfully heroes are able to avoid the grasp of death, and continue to protect the world, choosing suitably heroic mortals to serve as vessels of their legendary power.

subclassFeature.name: Extended Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Extended Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: The Legendary Hero Extended Spells
rows: {@spell dispel evil and good}, {@spell legend lore}

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Armory
entries: {@i 1st-level Legendary Hero feature}
When you make this Pact, your Patron infuses you with a portion of their legendary skill. You gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, and all martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Resilience
entries: {@i 1st-level Legendary Hero feature}

You can call on your Patron to reinvigorate your body with their legendary determination. As a bonus action, you can expend one of your Pact Magic spell slots to gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} per level of the Pact Magic spell slot that you expend + your Charisma modifier.
Unlike normal temporary hit points, these temporary hit points fade wen you finish your next short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 6th-level Legendary Hero feature}
The power granted to you by your heroic Patron increases your combat prowess. You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Determination
entries: {@i 10th-level Legendary Hero feature}

Your legendary Patron inspires you to fight on when others would fail. When you are forced to make a saving throw and fail, you can expend one of your Pact Magic spell slots to re-roll your saving throw, possibly turning a failure into a success.
You can only use this feature once per saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Champion
entries: {@i 14th-level Legendary Hero feature}
You directly channel your Patron allowing them to walk in the world once more. You can use an action on your turn to transform, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level.
Your weapon attacks deal force damage in place of any bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage on hit.
When you take the Attack action on your turn and make only melee weapon attacks, you can make three attacks as part of that action (instead of the normal two).

entries: This transformation lasts for 1 minute, and it ends early if you are incapacitated or choose to end it as a bonus action.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. If you have no uses remaining, you can expend a Pact Magic spell slot to transform again.

subclassFeature.name: The Great Wyrm
entries: Inherently magical creatures with incredibly long lifespans, dragons hoard not only wealth and material possessions, but servants and slaves as well. Benevolent and malicious, kind and terrible, good and evil, ancient dragons of all types have motivations beyond comprehension to most mortal beings.
What sort of bargain did you enter into in order to access the overwhelming elemental power of an ancient dragon?

subclassFeature.name: Extended Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Extended Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Spark
entries: {@i 1st-level Great Wyrm feature}

When you form this Pact, the Great Wyrm imbues you with a Draconic Spark, a fraction of its elemental power. Ancient dragons can impart any element, but they most often bestow one that matches their breath weapon. Choose either acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison for your Draconic Spark.
You gain resistance to the damage type of Draconic Spark, and any time you cast a warlock spell, you can choose for it to deal the damage type associated with your Draconic Spark.
Moreover, the magic of your Draconic Spark allows you to speak, read, and write Draconic.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Potency
entries: {@i 6th-level Great Wyrm feature}

Your Draconic Spark increases the potency of your magic. When you cast a warlock spell of 1st-level or higher that deals the damage of your Draconic Spark type, you gain a {@dice 1d8} bonus to one of the spell's damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Imposing Presence
entries: {@i 10th-level Great Wyrm feature}
Draconic magic has empowered your willpower and force of personality. You are immune to both the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Wings
entries: {@i 14th-level Great Wyrm feature}

You can use a bonus action to manifest a pair of leathery dragon wings from your back, which grant you a flying speed equal to your walking speed. These wings last until you use your bonus action to dismiss them.

You cannot manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is specifically made to accommodate them. Any clothes you are wearing that do not accommodate your wings are destroyed when you manifest them.

subclassFeature.name: The Mummy Lord
entries: Ancient monarchs and emperors of old who sought to extend their mortal lives could turn to sinister gods, bargaining their eternal soul for dark preservation. Known as Mummy Lords, these tyrants of ages past are often found deep in the ruins of their long dead empires, often swallowed by the sands. They enlist the help of mortals, imbuing them with a fraction of their accursed power, and look to rebuild their lost empires.

subclassFeature.name: Extended Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Extended Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Ancient Knowledge
entries: {@i 1st-level Mummy Lord feature}

Your accursed Patron has imbued you with knowledge of ancient days. You gain proficiency in your choice of either History or Religion. Whenever you make an ability check that uses the skill proficiency you gained from this feature, you treat a roll of 7 or lower on the d20 as an 8.

subclassFeature.name: Dreadful Curse
entries: {@i 1st-level Mummy Lord feature}

When you enter into your Pact with your Patron, you are taught forgotten curses in long dead tongues. As an action, you can force a creature who can hear you within 60 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and cannot speak for 1 minute.
The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the effects of your curse on a success.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. When you have no uses left, you can expend a Pact Magic spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Shifting Sands
entries: {@i 6th-level Mummy Lord feature}

You learn to disappear into the sands when in danger. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to dissolve into a pile of sand, gaining resistance to the damage of the triggering attack. You then reform in an unoccupied space of your choice within 60 feet that you can see.
You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Canoptic Preservation
entries: {@i 10th-level Mummy Lord feature}

Your Patron instructs you in their method of preservation. During the course of a long rest, you can spend 1 hour performing a ritual where you remove one of your organs and seal it within a Canoptic Jar, which has an Armor Class and hit points equal to your warlock level.

You can create one of these Jars with no penalty, but for each Canoptic Jar you create after the first, you must expend one of your Pact Magic spell slots. You can't regain the spell slot you expended in its creature until its Jar is destroyed.

When you are reduced to 0 hit points or killed, you can choose to return to 1 hit point at the beginning of your next turn by consuming the magic of one of your Canoptic Jars. That Canoptic Jar is instantly destroyed, and you regain the Pact Magic spell slot you expended to create that Jar.
You can also destroy one of your Jars as an action on your turn, regaining the Pact Magic spell slot contained within.

subclassFeature.name: Blasphemous Word
entries: {@i 14th-level Mummy Lord feature}

You learn to directly channel the sinister magic of your undead Patron. As an action, you can speak a word of ancient blasphemy, forcing creatures of your choice within 30 feet that can hear you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they are stunned until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: The Primeval Growth
entries: Not all who serve nature seek balance as Druidic Circles do. Older, and oftentimes more sinister forces are at work in the ancient forests of the world. Eldest of all plant life, ancient trees, sacred groves, and sentient forests can remember an age when plants, not mortals or beasts, dominated the land. These ancient beings are known as Primeval Growths, the power limited only by the roots that hold them in place.
Able to channel elder nature magic, these ancient beings lend their power to mortals who have the ability to move about the world, and can work to enact their primal will.

subclassFeature.name: Extended Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Extended Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Grasping Vines
entries: {@i 1st-level Primeval Growth feature}

When you enter your Pact with the Primeval Growth you are imbued with a seed of primeval magic. You learn the {@spell thorn whip} cantrip. It counts as a warlock cantrip for you, but it doesn't count against your number of Cantrips Known.

When you hit a creature with {@spell thorn whip}, or damage or restrain a creature with a Primeval Growth Spell, you can use a bonus action to drain the life from one target. The creature takes necrotic damage equal to your warlock level, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.
You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Primeval Resilience
entries: {@i 6th-level Primeval Growth feature}
Your primeval magic has made your flesh rough and treelike. Your Armor Class cannot be less than 16.
In addition, when you cast {@spell thorn whip}, you can target up to two creatures that are within the range of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Arboreal Guardian
entries: {@i 10th-level Primeval Growth feature}

You have become more plant then mortal. You are resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. You no longer require food or drink, as long as you spend at least 1 hour in sunlight each day.

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Forest
entries: {@i 14th-level Primeval Growth feature}

You can use an action to lash out with grasping roots. A number of creatures of your choice equal to your proficiency bonus within 30 feet must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. As an action, a restrained creature can make a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC, escaping on a success.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: The Titan
entries: At the dawn of creation the world was dominated by massive creatures; powerful giants bound together by the Ordning, hulking elementals that would become the landscape itself, and legendary Titans, like the Tarrasque, that still slumber beneath the earth. In remote places of the material plane these ancient beings sleep, their power dormant, waiting for an opportunity to remind the world of their existence.
Why were you chosen by a Titan? Are they trapped, and need someone to carry out their will in the world, or do you draw your power from an ancient slumbering giant?

subclassFeature.name: Extended Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Extended Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Elder Soul
entries: {@i 1st-level Titan feature}
The elder magic of your titanic Patron greatly enhances your vigor. Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a warlock level.

You also learn to speak, read, and write either Primordial or Giant (your choice). Whenever you make a Charisma check when interacting with elementals (if you chose Primordial) or giants (if you chose Giant), your proficiency bonus is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Colossal Form
entries: {@i 1st-level Titan feature}
You can use a bonus action on your turn to take on a Colossal Form, granting you the benefits below:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level.
Your size increases by one category. For example, if you are a Medium creature you would grow to become Large.
When you make a Strength-based ability check or saving throw, you add your Charisma modifier to the roll.
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack that uses your Strength, you gain a bonus to your damage roll equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

entries: Your Colossal Form lasts for 1 minute, but ends early if you are incapacitated or you choose to end it as a bonus action. Once you use your Colossal Form, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Titanic Endurance
entries: {@i 6th-level Titan feature}

You can draw upon the wondrous resilience of your Patron to reduce incoming damage. You gain a special pool of d8 dice that you can use to absorb incoming damage. This pool has a number of d8s equal to 1 + your warlock level.

As a reaction when you take damage, you can expend any number of dice from this pool, and reduce the damage by an amount equal to the dice roll + your Charisma modifier. Your pool regains all expended dice at the end of each long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Stalwart Blood
entries: {@i 10th-level Titan feature}

Your connection to your gargantuan patron has deepened. When you make a Constitution-based ability check or Constitution saving throw, you gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Behemoth
entries: {@i 14th-level Titan feature}

You have mastered the overwhelming magic of the Titan and wield its power with ease. When you enter your Colossal Form, you can choose to grow by two size categories, for example, from Medium to Huge. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack while transformed, you roll one of the weapon's damage dice an additional time.
In addition, once you adopt your Colossal Form, it lasts until you are incapacitated or end it as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: The Unblinking
entries: You have entered the service of one of the great and paranoid tyrants known only as Beholders. Their origins are unknown, but their presence is felt in nearly every major city and keep where mortals dwell. Preferring to have others do their dirty work, Beholders are known for employing vast networks of mortals to carry out their paranoid and tyrannical will.

subclassFeature.name: Extended Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Extended Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Unblinking Eye
entries: {@i 1st-level Unblinking feature}

When you enter this Pact with your Patron, your Patron magiaclly implants you with an additional Unblinking Eye, reminiscent of theirs, in the center of your forehead. You gain proficiency in Perception, and you add your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) to Wisdom (Perception) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Ocular Ray
entries: {@i 1st-level Unblinking feature}
You can use your Unblinking Eye as a spellcasting focus for any spell that requires an attack roll.

When using your Eye as a spellcasting focus, you must have at least one free hand to cast spells that require somatic or material components, and you must still provide material components that are consumed or have a gold cost.

subclassFeature.name: Unsleeping Awareness
entries: {@i 6th-level Unblinking feature}
The magic of your otherworldly Unblinking Eye has grown. You cannot be surprised, even if you are sleeping, as your Unblinking Eye remains ever alert.
Moreover, when you cast a spell and use your Eye as the spellcasting focus, you can add your Charisma modifier to the damage roll of that spell if you do not do so already.

subclassFeature.name: Prescient Sight
entries: {@i 10th-level Unblinking feature}

You can channel the eldritch power of your Patron to glimpse the near future. You can use an action to enter a heightened state of prescience for 10 minutes. You must concentrate on this state if you were concentrating on a spell. While in this state you gain the following benefits:

items: You add your Charisma modifier to your initiative rolls.
Creatures you can see cannot attack you with advantage.
When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to add {@dice 1d4} to your Armor Class against that attack.

entries: Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can enter this state of awareness again.

subclassFeature.name: Eye Tyrant
entries: {@i 14th-level Unblinking feature}

You have unlockd the true power of your Patron. You can use an action to have your Unblinking Eye emanate an antimagic zone in a 30 foot cone. The area of this cone is under the effects of the {@spell antimagic field} spell.
At the start of each of your turns, you decide which way your cone of antimagic faces until the start of your next turn.
Your Eye emanates this cone for 1 minute. The effect ends early if you are incapacitated or you choose to end the effect at the beginning of your turn (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: The Wild Hunt
entries: The Wild Hunt is a strange phenomenon that takes hold of mortals, driving them to hunt whatever poor creature they perceive to be their prey. The source of this phenomenon is unclear, but legends tell of raiding parties from the Feywild that draw wayward mortals into their hunt, or of individuals cursed by sinister druidic magic during the full moon.

While its exact origins are unclear, mortals who are bound to this force by a pact start to take on strange and unusual characteristics of the Feywild; sprouting antlers and their ears growing pointed. As their appearance changes, they slowly lose who they are, becoming one with the Wild Hunt.

subclassFeature.name: Extended Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Extended Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: The Wild Hunt Extended Spells
rows: {@spell find steed}, {@spell locate animals or plants}

subclassFeature.name: Wild Warrior
entries: {@i 1st-level Wild Hunt feature}
When you make your Pact with the Wild Hunt, it imbues you with supernatural skill. You gain proficiency in Survival, medium armor, shields, and martial weapons.
Also, when you would normally make a Wisdom (Survival) check, you can make a Charisma (Survival) check instead.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Quarry
entries: {@i 1st-level Wild Hunt feature}

You can mark your foe with the dark magic of the Wild Hunt. You can use a bonus action to mark a creature within 60 feet as your Quarry, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute, or until you mark another creature:

items: When you hit it with a weapon attack, you gain a bonus to your damage roll equal to your Charisma modifier.
When you hit it with a weapon attack, you can expend a Pact Magic spell slot to deal additional force damage to the target equal to {@dice 1d8} per level of the spell slot spent.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 6th-level Wild Hunt feature}
The Wild Hunt drives you to attack with the fervor of a true predator. You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit of the Hunt
entries: {@i 6th-level Wild Hunt feature}

When you mark your Quarry you can conjure a Spirit of the Hunt to harry its steps, forcing it to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, its speed is reduced by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Charisma modifier (minimum of 5 feet) for 1 minute. This speed reduction ends early if you mark another Quarry.
Once you use this feature to successfully slow a creature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Predatory Resolve
entries: {@i 10th-level Wild Hunt feature}

The savage fervor of the Wild Hunt heightens your predatory instincts. When your Quarry hits you with an attack, you can use a reaction to add your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) to your Armor Class against the attack.
As a reaction when the Spirit of the Hunt is summoned and your Quarry hits you with an attack, you can have the Spirit to absorb the full damage, instantly disappearing.

subclassFeature.name: Master of the Hunt
entries: {@i 14th-level Wild Hunt feature}

You can call on your allies to join you in the Wild Hunt. When you mark a creature as your Quarry, you can choose two creatures within 60 feet. These creatures can add your Charisma modifier to the damage of any weapon attacks they make against your Quarry.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Chalice
entries: Your Patron has bestowed upon you a vessel for the creation of potions and poultices. As an action, you can create a Pact Chalice in your empty hand. When summoned, it takes the form of a tiny object of your choice that is capable of holding liquids, and it grants you the benefits listed below:

items: You can use it as a spellcasting focus for warlock spells.

It counts as both a herbalism kit and a set of alchemist's supplies, and whenever you make an ability check that uses your Pact Chalice as either of these tools you can add double your proficiency bonus to your roll.

At the end of each short or long rest, you can use the Pact Chalice to conjure a vial of the following: alchemist's fire, acid, holy water, potion of healing, or potion of climbing. The liquid retains its potency until the end of your next long rest, at which point it becomes inert and unusable.

entries: Your Pact Chalice disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute, if you use this feature again, if you dismiss your Chalice (no action required), or if you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Trigger
entries: You can use your action to draw upon the powers of your Patron and create a hex gun in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this spellcasting focus takes each time you create it. It can either be a Sniper or a Revolver (detailed below).

Your hex gun acts as a spellcasting focus, and when you cast cantrips with it, it channels them as bullets (these still count as spells). Instead of increasing the damage of the cantrip when you reach certain levels, you can cast the cantrip additional times as part of the same action (except for {@spell Eldritch Blast}, which is cast as normal). To be cast in this way the cantrip must deal damage, it must make a spell attack or require a saving throw, and have a range other than self.

When you cast a cantrip in this manner, you cast it 2 times at level 5, 3 times at level 11, and 4 times at level 17. The cantrip can deal its damage more than once, but its other effects can't be applied again.

items: {@i {@b Sniper Form.}} Your ranged spell attack rolls cast through the hex gun have their range doubled and ignore half-cover. While wielding this weapon you know the {@spell ray of frost} cantrip.

{@i {@b Revolver Form.}} Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your ranged spell attack rolls cast through the hex gun. While wielding this weapon you know the {@spell shocking grasp} cantrip.

entries: Your hex gun disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss it (no action required), or if you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Blade
entries: Your Patron has granted you a weapon of otherworldly power. As an action, you can summon this Pact Weapon in an empty hand. It takes the form of a melee weapon of your choice each time you summon it, and it grants you the following benefits:

items: You can use your Charisma modifier, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls with this weapon.
The weapon counts as magical for the sake of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks.
You are proficient with this weapon if you weren't already.

entries: Your Pact Weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute, if you use this feature again, if you dismiss your Pact Weapon (no action required), or you die.

You can bond a magic melee weapon as your Pact Weapon by performing a 1-hour ritual. Once bonded, you can use an action to shunt it to an extradimensional space, or summon it. You cannot bond artifacts or sentient weapons, and you can only have one bonded Pact Weapon at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Hourglass
entries: Your Patron has gifted you a mystical timekeeping device. As an action, you can conjure this Pact Hourglass in your empty hand. When summoned, it takes the form of a timekeeping device of your choice, and it grants you the following benefits:

items: You can use it as a spellcasting focus for warlock spells.
When you are not surprised, you gain a bonus to initiative rolls equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can choose to re-roll. You can use this feature after you roll. Once you use this feature to turn failure into success, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

entries: Your Pact Hourglass disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute, if you use this feature again, if you dismiss your Hourglass (no action required), or you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Shroud
entries: Your Patron has gifted you a mystical cloak to shield you from harm and obscure your steps. As an action, you can summon this Pact Shroud, which takes the shape of a spectral cloak reminiscent of your Patron's magic. While wearing your Pact Shroud, you are invisible while you are obscured by shadows, darkness, or other natural phenomenon such as fog or mist.
Your Pact Shroud disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute, if you use this feature again, if you dismiss your Shroud (no action required), or you die.

You can bond a magic robe or cloak as your Pact Shroud by performing a 1-hour ritual. Once bonded, you can use an action to shunt it to an extradimensional space, or summon it. You cannot bond artifacts or sentient clothing, and you can only have one bonded Pact Shroud at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Strings
entries: Your Patron has granted you an instrument of otherworldly beauty. As an action, you can summon this Pact Instrument in an empty hand. It takes the form of a musical instrument of your choice, and it grants you the following benefits:

items: You can use it as a spellcasting focus for warlock spells.
You are considered proficient with it, and you add double your proficiency bonus to any check you make with it.
When you use it to cast a spell with a verbal component, or a spell that deals thunder damage, you gain a bonus to one of the spell's damage rolls equal to {@dice 1d8}.

entries: Your Pact Instrument disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute, if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the instrument (no action required), or you die.

You can bond a magic instrument as your Pact Instrument by performing a 1-hour ritual. Once bonded, you can use an action to shunt it to an extradimensional space, or summon it. You cannot bond artifacts or sentient instruments, and you can only have one bonded Pact Instrument at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: When you cast {@spell find familiar}, you infuse the summoned familiar with a measure of your eldritch power, granting the creature the following benefits:

items: The familiar gains either a flying speed or a swimming speed (your choice) of 40 feet.
As a bonus action, you can command the familiar to take the {@action Attack} action.
The familiar's weapon attacks are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks.

If the familiar forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier rather than it being equal to your spell save DC. It cannot benefit from Rod of the Pact Keeper.

The pseudodragon, in place of poison on its stinger, now deals acid damage instead of poison damage with its condition now simply being a magical effect (creatures with magic resistance have advantage on this save)
The sprite, in place of using poison on its shortbow, is now simply a magical effect.
The quasit, in place of poison on its claws, now uses necrotic damage and is not a poison, rather being a magical effect.
The imp, in place of poison on its stinger, now uses necrotic damage and is now a magical effect.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: You learn the {@spell find familiar} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, {@creature quasit}, or {@creature sprite}.
Additionally, when you take the {@action Attack} action, you can forgo one of your own attacks to allow your familiar to use its reaction to make one attack of its own.
You add hit point to your familiar equal to 3 * Your Warlock Levels

entries.name: Might of the Master
entries: The following numbers increase by 1 when your proficiency bonus increases by 1: the familiar’s skill and saving throw bonuses (and the bonuses to hit and damage of its attacks).

entries.name: Eldritch Reconstruction
entries: As an action, your familiar heals for 2d8 + 2 hit points. The +2 scales with Might of the Master. This ability has 3 charges, and you regain all expended charges on a long rest.

entries.name: Pact of the Chain familiars have received a few changes:
entries: The pseudodragon‘s poison lasts for one minute, and creatures can attempt the save at the end of their turns.
The poisoned condition for sprites now allows for a creature to make a save at the end of each of their turns.

optionalfeature.name: Graceful Technique
entries: You learn one flourish of your choice from among those available to the Fencer archetype in the fighter class at level 3. If a flourish requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the flourish’s effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. You must follow the prerequisites outlined in the Fencer archetype to perform flourishes and use your precision die. Should you already know all the flourishes available at level 3, you instead add a +1 to attack rolls you make with finesse melee weapons.

You gain one precision die, which is a {@dice d8} (this die is added to any precision die you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your flourishes. A precision die is expended when you use it. You regain precision die when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Bound Steed
entries: You can cast {@spell find steed} once without expending a spell slot.
You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Blade
entries: When you summon a one handed weapon with the light property as your weapon with the Pact of the Blade Feature, you can summon a weapon of the same type in your other hand as a bonus action.

Both summoned weapons count as your pact weapon for the purposes of class features. In addition, when engaging in two weapon fighting you may add your relevant ability modifier to the damage of your off hand attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Teacher of the Arcane
entries: You gain the ability to impart your abilities onto your allies. When you cast a warlock spell with a casting time of 1 action, you can hold your Book of Shadows and increase its casting time to 1 minute. You expend the spell slot, but none of the spell’s effects occur. Instead, the spell transfers into one of your book's pages for later use. This page can be torn out and given to another creature so they may cast it. Any creature holding the page thereafter can use an action to activate the spell. The creature holding the page casts the spell at the spell slot level used to make it, though the spell is cast using your spellcasting ability.

You may only have one of these pages active at a time, and you cannot regain your spell slot maximum until it is cast. The page remains enchanted until your next short or long rest, at which point the page turns to ash and you regain the spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Booming Aura
entries: When you cast the cantrip {@spell booming blade|tce}, all creatures within 5 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw equal to your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes thunder damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0).

optionalfeature.name: Green-Flame Chain
entries: When you cast the cantrip {@spell green-flame blade|tce}, flames leap from the second creature the cantrip targets to a third within 5 feet of it inflicting fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Unerring Blast
entries: When you cast the eldritch blast cantrip, and one of your spell attacks misses its target, you can use your bonus action to make another attack roll in an attempt to hit the creature you missed.

optionalfeature.name: Voice of the Rune Master
entries: You can cast {@spell tongues} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Blessing of the Spider Queen
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Sacrifice
entries: As a reaction when you make a saving throw, you can expend a warlock spell slot to succeed on the saving throw instead of rolling to determine an outcome. You cannot use this feature to succeed on a save you have already attempted and failed.

optionalfeature.name: Mistbringer
entries: Fog, mist, rain, snow, dust, smoke, and similar substances do not obscure your vision, and you can cast {@spell fog cloud} once using a warlock spell slot. You can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldy Grace
entries: You gain proficiency in the Acrobatics skill, and your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldy Resilience
entries: As a bonus action, you can regain a number of hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your Warlock level. You can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Whisperless
entries: You can cast {@spell silence} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components. You and your spells can ignore the effects of magical silence.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldy Strength
entries: You gain proficiency in the Athletics skill, and your melee weapon attacks deal double damage to objects and structures.

optionalfeature.name: Bond of Loyalty
entries: Whenever you or your familiar would take damage, the other can use their reaction to magically take the damage instead of the target taking it. This doesn't transfer any effects that might accompany the damage. You can only use this feature if your familiar is within 100 feet of you.
Should this damage reduce the familiar or Warlock to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to the original target.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: You have awakened your senses and can sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you as well as you can see or hear.

When you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, instantly learning its school of magic, if any. Your magic sense is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of Many Faces
entries: Strange and sinister magics have made your form fluid. As an action, you can change your physical appearance and voice to match that of a creature that you have seen before, so long as your new appearance has the same arrangement of limbs you do. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your race, coloration, hair length, sex, height, and weight, but not so much that your size changes.
This transformation does not affect clothing or equipment, and it has no effect on your game statistics.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Secrets
entries: You have unearthed a fragment of powerful arcane lore. You learn one spell of your choice from the Warlock spell list of 4th-level or lower, and you can cast once, at its lowest level without expending a spell slot. Once you cast it in this way you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.
You can gain this Invocation more than once, but you must select a new Warlock spell each time you do, and you can only learn one Warlock spell per spell level in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Favored Servant
entries: Your Patron has granted you a gift. You can cast one of your Extended Spells at a level equal to your Pact Magic spell slots without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in that way again.

optionalfeature.name: Favor of the Master
entries: You grant your Familiar a greater measure of your power. At the end of a long rest, choose one Warlock spell you know of 1st-level or higher. The Familiar can cast that spell once, at a level equal to your Pact Magic spell slots.

optionalfeature.name: Book of Eldritch Secrets
entries: You learn two extra spells of your choice from the warlock spell list. These spells must be of a level you can cast with a warlock spell slot, and the chosen spells don’t count against the number of spells you know for the class.

optionalfeature.name: Book of Unfettered Lore
entries: For any invocations that grant spells that use warlock spell slots, you can ignore any restrictions that limit how often those spells can be cast per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Bound Greater Steed
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell find greater steed|xge} once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Lasso
entries: With this invocation you can choose to hold a target instead of pulling it closer with the cantrip {@spell lightning lure|tce}. If you use it this way the target takes the lightning damage from the cantrip as normal per round they stay grappled. The target can break free with a Strength saving throw at the end of its turn against your spell save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Many Chains
entries: You gain a second familiar of the same type as the one you already have.
Familiars summoned via this invocation count as one creature for the purposes of attunement.

optionalfeature.name: Searing Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon, the creature takes extra radiant damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You cannot take this invocation if you already have the Lifedrinker invocation.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Mystic Arcanum
entries: You select a second 6th-level Mystic Arcanum spell, and once per long rest, you regain the use of your 6th-level Mystic Arcanum at the end of a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Two Minds in One
entries: When you cast a concentration spell, your familiar can hold concentration on that spell for you and increase your total number of concentration spells you can maintain at the same time (maximum of 2).

If, while concentrating, your familiar moves more than 30 feet from you, is incapacitated, fails a concentration check, or dies, then concentration on the spell is lost, and you must succeed on a concentration check with a DC of 10 + the level of the spell your familiar was concentrating on or become Stunned until the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Ally of Nature
entries: You can cast {@spell awaken} once using a warlock spell slot. You can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. The creature you awakened is also imbued with your patron's magic, taking on an appearance similar to the theme of your patron.

optionalfeature.name: Aspect of Jubilex
entries: Any spell granted to you by your Expanded Spell list that deals fire damage may instead deal acid damage, and melts flammable objects in the area rather than burning them.
Additionally, your body takes on an amorphous property. You can now move through the spaces of larger creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Baalzebul
entries: Creatures within 30 feet of you automatically lose any immunity to the poisoned condition they may possess, and any such creature's immunity to poison damage becomes resistance while within your aura.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Blessing
entries: You can cast {@spell Bless} as a 1st level spell at will without maintaining concentration. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain any expended uses after completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Instincts
entries: You can cast {@spell detect evil and good} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Seal
entries: You can halt the flow of a creature's life force with your attacks. Once per turn, when you successfully hit a creature with a warlock cantrip, that creature cannot be healed or benefit from healing effects until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Everlasting Counsel
entries: You may cast {@spell augury} at will, without expending a spell slot. In addition, you may cast {@spell augury} one additional time before incurring the chance of a random reading.

optionalfeature.name: Hellfire
entries: You may cast {@spell meteor swarm} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: High Tide
entries: You can cast {@spell tidal wave|xge} at the 3rd level up to an amount of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Rite of Returning
entries: You can cast {@spell clone} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Servants of the Green Path
entries: You can cast {@spell conjure animals} once using a warlock spell slot. You can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Blast From the Deep
entries: You can infuse your blast with the power of the deep to curse your foes. When you use cast a Warlock cantrip that does damage, you can deal cold or lightning damage (your choice) instead of the normal damage for the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Arcing Storm
entries: You can cast the {@spell lightning lure|tce} and {@spell shocking grasp} cantrips, with Charisma being your spellcasting ability for them. When you cast either spell as an action on your turn, you can immediately cast it again as part of the same action against a different creature within 10 feet of the initial target, ignoring the range of each spell when cast as the second part of this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Disciple of the Storm
entries: You've studied the ways of the storm. You can tell when an area has been ravaged by a storm, and can also sense when a nonmagical storm will arrive in an area that you're in, up to 24 hours before the storm hits.

Additionally, you ignore the creature size restriction of {@spell gust|xge}, and can cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Strikes Twice
entries: When the blast of lightning strikes down as part of your Sky Splitter feature, you can have it mark the spot again, which continues to spark with energy. At the start of your next turn, another lightning bolt strikes down, and hostile creatures inside the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, creatures take {@dice 4d12} lightning damage, or half as much on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Storm's Vengeance
entries: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can mark them with the fury of the storm, which lasts for 1 minute. When you hit a marked creature with a pact weapon, they take an additional {@dice 1d12} lightning damage from the attack, you can push them up to 10 feet in a horizontal direction of your choice, and you the mark is removed. If the attack that removed the mark was a melee weapon attack, you can push the creature an additional 10 feet.
You have a number of uses of this mark equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and regain all uses  when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Updraft
entries: You're always under the effects of the {@spell feather fall} spell while you aren't wearing heavy armour and aren't unconscious or incapacitated. You can end this effect or activate it on your turn (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Wind Spirit
entries: When you summon your familiar, you can have it appear as a wind spirit. Your familiar has the statistics of a blood hawk (found on page 319 of the Monster Manual) except it is an elemental, rather than a celestial, fey, or fiend.

While the spirit is perched on your shoulder, your movement speed increases by 10 feet and you gain a bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score and to Wisdom (Perception) checks. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Ascendant Step
entries: You can cast {@spell levitate} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Vigor
entries: You can cast {@spell false life} on yourself without expending a spell slot. When you cast the spell with this feature, you don’t roll the die for the Temporary Hit Points; you automatically get the highest number on the die.

optionalfeature.name: Gaze of Two Minds
entries: You can use a Bonus Action to touch a willing creature and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can use a Bonus Action on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. The connection ends if you don’t maintain it in this way. While perceiving through the other creature’s senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you can cast spells as if you were in your space or the other creature’s space if the two of you are within 60 feet of each other.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Myriad Forms
entries: You can cast {@spell alter self} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: One with Shadows
entries: While you’re in an area of Dim Light or Darkness, you can cast {@spell Invisibility} on yourself without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Whispers of the Grave
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with dead} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Visions of Distant Realms
entries: You can cast {@spell arcane eye} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Leap
entries: You can cast {@spell jump} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Lifedrinker
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with your pact weapon, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} extra Necrotic, Psychic, or Radiant damage (your choice), and you can expend one of your Hit Dice to roll it and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Spear
entries: When you cast a Warlock cantrip that has a range of at least 10 feet, its range increases by a number of feet equal to 30 times your Warlock level.

optionalfeature.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: You can add your spellcasting ability modifier to any Warlock cantrip's damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Repelling Blast
entries: When you damage a creature with a Warlock cantrip on your turn, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you in a straight line.

optionalfeature.name: Lance of Lethargy
entries: Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with a Warlock cantrip, you can reduce that creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp of Hadar
entries: Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with a Warlock cantrip, you can move that creature in a straight line 10 feet closer to you.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Strike
entries: For you, the range of {@spell eldritch blast} is reduced to 5 feet and it becomes a melee spell attack. Make a separate melee spell attack for each beam, dealing {@dice 1d12} force damage on hit.
Any class features or Eldritch Invocations that affect the range of {@spell eldritch blast} do not work with this Invocation.

optionalfeature.name: Harmonic Spellcasting
entries: When you cast a warlock spell with a verbal component while using your pact instrument as your spellcasting focus, the saving throw DC for that spell increases by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Combatant I
entries: Your Patron has infused your body with technical knowledge and martial skills. You gain the following features:

entries.name: Martial Exploits
entries: You learn two {@filter Exploits|optionalfeatures|feature type=LL:ME} of your choice from those available to Fighter (Alternate). If an Exploit has a prerequisite fighter level, you can learn it if you are the same level in warlock. You can only use one Exploit per ability check or attack. When you gain a level, you can replace an Exploit you know with another of your choice.

entries.name: Exploit Dice
entries: You have two d4 Exploit Dice. To use an Exploit you must expend one of these dice, and you regain all expended Exploit Dice when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some of your Exploits require your target to make a saving throw to resist your Martial Exploit's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Combatant II
entries: Your Eldritch martial skill increases. You gain an additional Exploit Die, and all of your Exploit Dice become d6s. You also learn two additional Martial Exploits of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Combatant III
entries: Your Eldritch martial skill increases. You gain an additional Exploit Die, and all of your Exploit Dice become d8s. You also learn two additional Martial Exploits of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Combatant IV
entries: Your Eldritch martial skill increases. You gain an additional Exploit Die, and all of your Exploit Dice become d10s. You also learn two additional Martial Exploits of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Knowledge of Antiquity
entries: When you make an Intelligence (History) check related to an event, in the place where that event took place, you see echos of the past and treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

optionalfeature.name: Mirror of Fates
entries: You can peer into the uncertain future. Using your Pact Chalice as a spellcasting focus, you can cast {@spell augury} at-will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Protective Cowl
entries: When you take damage while wearing your Pact Shroud, you can use your reaction to gain resistance to the damage from that attack, but your Pact Shroud disappears, and you must finish a short or long rest before you can summon it again.

optionalfeature.name: Crippling Shot
entries: Once per turn, when you damage an enemy with an attack made using your hex gun, you can force them to make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or fall {@condition prone} and have their speed reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and regain all expended uses after completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Reckless Fire
entries: Your shots are like a rain of lead. When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for a cantrip you cast with your hex gun in revolver form, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

optionalfeature.name: Repeating Cantrips
entries: When you fire a cantrip through your hex gun, its secondary effects (such as the speed reduction from {@spell ray of frost}) can apply multiple times but not more than once per creature.

optionalfeature.name: Ricochet
entries: When you hit a creature with a cantrip cast with your hex gun, you can immediately cause the hit to wound a second creature within 15 feet of the original target. The second target takes damage (of the type of the cantrip) equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one).
You can redirect a hit in this way a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and regain all expended uses after a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte
entries: When an enemy attacks you with a melee attack, you can fire a special bullet to counter it as a reaction before being hit. Make a melee or ranged spell attack. On a hit, the enemy takes {@damage 1d10} piercing damage, its attack fails and it is knocked back directly away from you a number of feet equal to five times the number rolled on the {@dice d10}.
You can counter a hit in this way a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and regain all expended uses after a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dead Eye
entries: When using your hex gun in Sniper form, if you haven't moved this turn, you can take aim as a bonus action, reducing your speed to 0 and granting you advantage on all attacks you make using your hex gun until the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Headshots
entries: When using your hex gun in Sniper form, once per long rest, as a bonus action you can enhance your focus to see the weak spots of your foes. For the next minute, attacks you make using your hex gun in Sniper form score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the dice.

optionalfeature.name: Bullet Hell
entries: When using your hex gun in Revolver form, you can temporarily duplicate your hex gun to unleash a flurry of bullets as an action. All creatures within a 10 foot cone in front of you must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 3d10} force damage, half damage on a successful save. This damage increases to {@damage 4d10} at level 11 and {@damage 5d10} at level 17. To use this action you need to be holding your hex gun in one hand and have the other hand free.
You can use this action a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and regain all expended uses after completing a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Cup of Recovery
entries: Using your pact chalice as a spellcasting focus, you can use an action to cast {@spell lesser restoration} without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Cloak of Winds
entries: Your pact shroud billows out around you, slowing your fall and allowing you to glide. When you fall, you can subtract up to 100 feet from your fall when calculating your fall damage and can move horizontally 2 feet for every 1 foot you fall.

optionalfeature.name: Cup of Protection
entries: As an action, a creature of your choice can drink from your Pact Chalice, gaining the effects of {@spell death ward}. Once used, you must finish a long rest to use this feature again.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Shroud
entries: While wearing your Pact Shroud while in darkness or shadows, you are considered invisible to any creature that relies on darkvision or devil's sight to see in that darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Time Dilation
entries: Once per long rest, you can cast {@spell haste}, at a level equal to your Pact Magic spell slots, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Cloak of Twilight
entries: You learn the {@spell greater invisibility} spell, but it doesn't count against your total number of Spells Known, and you can cast {@spell greater invisibility} once without expending spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Enchanting Melody
entries: You learn the {@spell charm monster|xge} spell, but it doesn't count against your total number of Spells Known, and you can cast {@spell charm monster|xge} once without expending spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Restoration
entries: As an action on your turn, you can cast {@spell reincarnate} without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you cast {@spell reincarnate} in this way, you must finish {@dice 1d4} long rests before you can cast the spell in this way again.

optionalfeature.name: Temporal Rewind
entries: As a reaction when you finish your turn, you can undo everything that happened on your turn. You return to the space you began that turn in and you regain all resources you expended. You can then immediately repeat your turn.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.
